intro: Elytranthe neurophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elytranthe, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Elytranthe neurophylla is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
